clinical_study.brief_title: An EHR-based Platform To Facilitate Outcomes and Research Methods in Cerebrovascular Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: A Platform for Linking and Assessing To Facilitate Outcomes and Research Methods in CerebroVascular Diseases Using Electronic Health Records (PLATFORM-CVD)

lead_sponsor.agency: Ministry of Science and Technology of the People´s Republic of China

collaborator.agency: New Area People's Hospital of Luoyang
Chinese Traditional Medicine Hospital of Meishan
Hexigten Banner Mongolian Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital
Inner Mongolian Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine
The Affiliated Hospital of Qingdao University
The Second Affiliated Hospital of Luohe Medical College

clinical_study.source: Ministry of Science and Technology of the People´s Republic of China

brief_summary.textblock: In this protocol, the investigators present methods and preliminary results from the PLATFORM-CVD Study, an EHR-based multicenter cohort. This study will focus on assessing the distribution of major cerebrovascular diseases, determining the risk factors associated with disease incidence and worse in-hospital outcomes, as well as describing the quality of care. Data from this cohort will be used to develop suitable prediction models for cerebrovascular diseases using real-world data and to understand how outcomes for cerebrovascular diseases would change with quality improvement interventions.

detailed_description.textblock:
Adherence to healthcare quality measures is needed to reduce the burden of cerebrovascular disease and improve clinical outcomes. Electronic health records (EHRs) can facilitate the standardization of care provision and the improvement of disease prediction and prevention. Although the EHRs in clinical settings are increasingly prevalent in China, they are rarely used for healthcare research. the investigators aimed to conduct an EHR-based registry study to improve the healthcare and outcomes for cerebrovascular diseases.
Twenty-four hospitals were enrolled in the PLATFORM-CVD Study in January 2018. Data collection began on February 1st, 2019. Historical data from January 2017 are abstracted first and prospective data are continuously reported until May 20th, 2020. Data were abstracted from the medical records, including hospital information system, laboratory information management system, and picture archiving and communication systems by an extract-transform-load tool. The EHR system included diagnostic information for cerebral infarctions (I63), nontraumatic intracerebral hemorrhages (I61), nontraumatic subarachnoid hemorrhages (I60), transient cerebral ischemic attacks and related syndromes (G45), intracranial and intraspinal phlebitis and thrombophlebitis (G08), vascular dementia (F01), and other aneurysms (I72). The quality of stroke care was assessed by 21 evidence-based performance measures. In-hospital outcomes were calculated including mortality, length of stay, and costs.
The PLATFORM-CVD Study leverages EHRs to better understand incident cerebrovascular diseases in China. Data from this cohort will serve as a unique platform for quality assessment and improvement for acute treatment and secondary prevention of cerebrovascular diseases, as well as in-hospital outcome risk predictions and health economic evaluations.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
primary_outcome.description: Patients who died during hospitalization due to cerebrovascular diseases

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
primary_outcome.description: The total days for a patients with cerebrovascular diseases at hospitalization

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
primary_outcome.description: The total costs for a patients with cerebrovascular diseases at hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of antiplatelet medication use
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of antiplatelet therapy during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of dual antiplatelet medication use for non-disabling IS and TIA events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of aspirin and clopidogrel therapy for ischemic cerebrovascular diseases (IS or TIA) during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of DVT prophylaxis ≤ 48 hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours within hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Patients at risk for DVT (non-ambulatory) who received DVT prophylaxis by end of hospital 48 hours, including pneumatic compression, warfarin sodium, and novel oral anticoagulant

secondary_outcome.measure: Cerebrovascular assessment ≤ seven days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days within hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebrovascular assessment (TCD, IVUS, brain CT or MR scan) within seven days of hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Statin therapy for LDL ≥100 mg/dL during hospitalization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Lipid lowering agent prescribed during hospitalization if LDL ≥ 100 mg/dL, if patient treated with lipid lowering agent prior to admission, or LDL not documented

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of anticoagulation medication use for atrial fibrillation during hospitalization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Anticoagulation prescribed during hospitalization in patients with documented atrial fibrillation

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of antithrombotic medication prescribtion at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Antithrombotic therapy prescribed at discharge, including antiplatelet or anticoagulant therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of antihypertensive medication prescribtion for patients with hypertension at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Antihypertension medication prescribed at discharge for patients with history of hypertension disease or hypertension disease documented during the hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of statin prescribtion for low-density lipoprotein≥100 mg/dL at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Lipid lowering agent prescribed at discharge if LDL ≥ 100 mg/dL, if patient treated with lipid lowering agent prior to admission, or LDL not documented

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of hypoglycaemia medication prescribtion for diabetes mellitus at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Hypoglycemic medication prescribed at discharge for patients with history of diabetes mellitus or diabetes mellitus documented during the hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of anticoagulation medication prescribtion for atrial fibrillation at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Anticoagulation prescribed at discharge in patients with documented atrial fibrillation

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of thrombolytic therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Intravenous r-tPA in IS patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of thrombectomy therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Thrombectomy therapy for IS patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of DVT prophylaxis ≤ 48 hours for ICH
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours within hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with ICH at risk for DVT (non-ambulatory) who received DVT prophylaxis by end of hospital 48 hours, including pneumatic compression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of antihypertensive medicine use for ICH patients with hypertension at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Antihypertension medication prescribed at discharge for ICH patients with history of hypertension disease or hypertension disease documented during the hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of hypoglycemia medication use for ICH patients with diabetes mellitus at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Hypoglycemic medication prescribed at discharge for ICH patients with history of diabetes mellitus or diabetes mellitus documented during the hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of neurosurgery for ICH patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Neurosurgery of ICH include removal of hematoma by craniotomy, aspiration of hematoma by drilling, decompressive craniectomy, ventriculocentesis and drainage, other removal of intracranial hematoma

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of DVT prophylaxis ≤ 48 hours for SAH
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours within hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with SAH at risk for DVT (non-ambulatory) who received DVT prophylaxis by end of hospital 48 hours, including pneumatic compression

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of antihypertensive medicine use for SAH patients with hypertension at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Antihypertension medication prescribed at discharge for SAN patients with history of hypertension disease or hypertension disease documented during the hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of hypoglycemia medication use for SAH patients with diabetes mellitus at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Hypoglycemic medication prescribed at discharge for SAH patients with history of diabetes mellitus or diabetes mellitus documented during the hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of neurosurgery for SAH patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospitalization until the date of discharge, assessed up to 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Neurosurgery of SAH include aneurysm clipping, endovascular embolization of aneurysm, extraventricular shunt

study_pop.textblock: Twenty-five hospitals were enrolled in the PLATFORM-CVD Study between January 1st, 2017 and May 20th, 2020. Hospitals were included if they: 1) had neurological wards; 2) were secondary or tertiary hospitals; 3) could admit at least 20 cerebrovascular disease patients every month.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients were included in the registry if they were hospitalized with a primary diagnose of：
- cerebral infarction (I63)
- nontraumatic intracerebral hemorrhage (I61)
- nontraumatic subarachnoid hemorrhage (I60)
- transient cerebral ischemic attack and related syndromes (G45)
- intracranial and intraspinal phlebitis and thrombophlebitis (G08)
- vascular dementia (F01)
- other aneurysms (I72)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with other diseases.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Ministry of Science and Technology of the People´s Republic of China

patient_data.ipd_description: We will share the data dictionary of the study. The data could be applied by the PI's email. Applicant should make an SAP first. The PI will check the SAP and appoint a statistician for the analysis.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: The data will be available when the data collection finished.
